net.sf.mmm.search.engine.api

Interface ComplexSearchQuery

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SearchQuery
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LuceneComplexSearchQuery

    public interface ComplexSearchQuery
extends SearchQuery
    This is the interface of a query that combines other queries.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    SearchQueryBuilder.createComplexQuery(), addRequiredQuery(SearchQuery), addExcludingQuery(SearchQuery), addOptionalQuery(SearchQuery)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addExcludingQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
      This method adds the given subQuery as excluding sub-query.
      void addOptionalQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
      This method adds the given subQuery as optional sub-query.
      void addRequiredQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
      This method adds the given subQuery as required sub-query.
      int getSubQueryCount()
      This method gets the number of sub-queries that have been added to this query.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.mmm.search.engine.api.SearchQuery

        toString

    • Method Detail

      • addRequiredQuery

        void addRequiredQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
        This method adds the given subQuery as required sub-query. A entry has to match the subQuery in order to match this complex query.
        Parameters:
        subQuery - is the sub-query to add.

      • addOptionalQuery

        void addOptionalQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
        This method adds the given subQuery as optional sub-query. A entry should match the subQuery in order to match this complex query. Else if other sub-queries match, this complex query can still match with a lower score.
        Parameters:
        subQuery - is the sub-query to add.

      • addExcludingQuery

        void addExcludingQuery(SearchQuery subQuery)
        This method adds the given subQuery as excluding sub-query. A entry must NOT match the subQuery in order to match this complex query.
        Parameters:
        subQuery - is the sub-query to add.

      • getSubQueryCount

        int getSubQueryCount()
        This method gets the number of sub-queries that have been added to this query.
        Returns:
        the number of sub-queries.
